text:
<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRUIT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 tablespoon unflavored gelatin
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 (8 oz) package Philadelphia cream cheese
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1/2 cup cream, whipped
- 1/2 cup chopped nuts
- 1/2 cup maraschino cherries, chopped
- 1 small can crushed pineapple, drained
- 1 small can fruit cocktail, drained
<|steps|>
Soften gelatin in lemon juice, then set in a pan of boiling water to dissolve.
Combine cream cheese, mayonnaise, salt, and sugar; add dissolved gelatin.
Fold in whipped cream, nuts, cherries, pineapple, and fruit cocktail.
Pour into a tray and refrigerate until firm, several hours or overnight.
Slice and serve on a lettuce leaf with a dab of mayonnaise and a cherry on top.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOT BUTTERED PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- ¾ cup brown sugar, firmly packed
- 1 cup water
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon allspice
- ¾ teaspoon cloves
- 2 cans jellied cranberries
- 3 cups water
- 1 quart pineapple juice
- Butter, for serving
<|steps|>
Bring brown sugar, 1 cup water, salt, nutmeg, cinnamon, allspice, and cloves to a boil.
Crush cranberry sauce with a fork or mixer, add 3 cups water, and beat until smooth.
Add cranberry liquid and pineapple juice to the spiced syrup and heat to boiling.
Serve hot, with dots of butter in each cup of punch.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FLOSSIE'S MARSHMALLOW SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1 tablespoon flour
- 2 1/2 tablespoons vinegar
- 1 teaspoon mustard
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon butter
- 2 egg yolks
- 1 can diced pineapple
- 1 can seeded white cherries
- 2 boxes marshmallows, cut
- Whipped cream
<|steps|>
In a double boiler, cook sugar, flour, vinegar, mustard, salt, butter, and egg yolks until thick.
Thin the mixture with half-cut or plain cream.
Add pineapple, cherries, and marshmallows.
Let stand for several hours.
Fold in whipped cream before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **APRICOT LOAF**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups sifted all-purpose flour
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 egg, unbeaten
- 1 cup milk
- 2 tablespoons melted shortening or salad oil
- 1 to 2 cups dried apricots, washed and drained
- 1 tablespoon grated orange rind (optional)
<|steps|>
Sift flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt into a small bowl.
Add egg, milk, and shortening; mix until just blended, about 30 seconds.
Cut apricots into fourths with scissors and fold into the batter with orange rind, being careful not to overmix.
Pour into a greased 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F for 55-60 minutes.
Remove from pan and cool before cutting.
**By Hand:** Beat egg, then mix with milk and shortening; add to sifted dry ingredients, blend, fold in apricots and orange rind, and bake as above.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MANDARIN ORANGE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cans mandarin oranges
- 1 cup miniature marshmallows
- 1/2 pint sour cream
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 cup coconut
- 1/2 cup slivered almonds
- 1 small can crushed pineapple
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients together.
Store in the refrigerator overnight.
Serve on lettuce.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MARSHMALLOW CREAM FUDGE**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 cup. sugar
- 1 (13 oz.) can Pet milk
- 2 sticks oleo
- 1 jar marshmallow cream
- 3 (6 oz.) pkgs. chocolate chips
- 3 cup. chopped pecans
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 lb. butter
- 1 lb. light brown sugar
- 1 cup. white Karo
- 1 can Eagle Brand milk
- Nuts (optional)
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1/4 tsp. soda
- 1 cup. evaporated milk
- 2 cup. pecans
- 2 Tbsp. butter
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, milk, and oleo; cook until it forms a soft ball in ice water, about 20 minutes, stirring constantly.
Add marshmallow cream, chocolate chips, pecans, and vanilla; blend well.
Pour into a greased pan and chill until firm.
**CARAMELS**
Melt butter, add Karo, brown sugar, and milk; cook until it forms a soft, firm ball, stirring constantly.
Pour into a slightly buttered pan.
Add nuts if desired.
When cold, cut and wrap individually.
**PRALINES**
Mix sugar and soda well, add milk, and cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until it forms a soft ball.
Remove from heat, add butter, vanilla, and pecans.
Stir until thick and creamy enough to drop by spoon onto greased foil.
Add a spoon of water if needed to maintain dropping consistency.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PRUNE CAKE OR PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup Wesson oil
- 1.5 cups sugar
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 2 cups flour
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1 tsp baking powder
- 1 tsp cinnamon
- 1 tsp nutmeg
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 tsp vanilla
- 1 cup chopped prunes
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 2 tsp Karo syrup
- 1 stick margarine or butter
<|steps|>
Mix oil and 1.5 cups sugar, then add eggs, 1 cup buttermilk, flour, 1 tsp each of baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and vanilla.
Flour pecans and prunes with some flour, then add to mixture.
Pour into a greased, floured 8x8x2-inch pan.
Bake at 350°F for about 1 hour.
For sauce, cook 1 cup sugar, 1 cup buttermilk, 1 tsp baking soda, Karo, and margarine to soft ball stage; add 1 tsp vanilla.
Pour hot sauce over warm cake and let stand until absorbed.
Cut into squares, for 8 large servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN SPAGHETTI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cooked chicken, deboned
- 1 lb. spaghetti
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 cup. chopped green pepper
- 1/2 cup. grated cheese
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Cook spaghetti, drain.
Sauté onion and green pepper, add soup, salt, and pepper.
Mix chicken, spaghetti, and sauce, place in casserole, top with cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SWEET-DILL PICKLES**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 gal. cucumbers
- Alum powder (1 Tbsp. per gal. of water)
- Dill sprigs
- 6 lb. sugar
- 2 pt. white sugar
- 1 box pickling spice
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. tarragon vinegar
<|steps|>
Wash cucumbers and soak in brine (strong enough to float an egg, non-iodized salt) for 8 days.
Soak in clear water for 24 hours.
Cut into strips and soak in alum water (1 Tbsp. alum per gal. water) for 48 hours.
Rinse cucumbers and jars.
Place cucumbers and dill sprigs in jars, cover with hot syrup made from sugar and pickling spice.
Add 1 1/2 Tbsp. tarragon vinegar the next morning.
Weigh down and let set for 7-10 days.
Pack in quart jars with a dill sprig, heat syrup, and seal.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRUIT COCKTAIL CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 11/2 cups sugar
- 2 cups flour
- 2 teaspoons baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2 eggs
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 can (No. 2) fruit cocktail
- 1 cup coconut
- 1/2 cup pecans
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1 stick margarine
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1 cup sugar
<|steps|>
Sift flour, 1½ cups sugar, baking soda, and salt together.
Add eggs, vanilla, and fruit cocktail; beat well by hand (do not use a mixer).
Pour into a greased 13 x 9 x 3-inch pan.
Mix ½ cup coconut, pecans, and brown sugar; sprinkle over the batter.
Bake at 325°F for 1 hour; do not remove from pan.
For the frosting, cook margarine, ½ cup milk, and 1 cup sugar for about 1 minute; pour over the hot cake.
Sprinkle remaining ½ cup coconut and ½ cup pecans on top.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ICE BOX DESSERT (OR SALAD)**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 eggs
- 1 cup sugar
- Juice of 2 lemons
- 1 tablespoon (1 pkg) gelatin
- 1/4 cup cold water
- 1 box Dream Whip
- 1 No. 3 can sliced pineapple, chopped
- 1 can Morgan dark sweet cherries
- 1/2 cup miniature marshmallows
- 1/2 cup pecans, chopped
<|steps|>
Beat eggs until thick, add sugar and lemon juice, and cook until thick (like pie filling).
Dissolve gelatin in cold water, then stir into the egg mixture; set aside to cool.
Prepare Dream Whip according to package instructions.
Chop pineapple, cherries, and pecans.
Fold fruit, nuts, marshmallows, and Dream Whip into the cooled egg mixture.
Pour into a large pan and chill for at least 24 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DUTCH SANDWICH**
<|ingredients|>
- Rye bread rounds
- 1 small dill pickle, finely chopped
- 2 hard-boiled eggs, finely chopped
- 1 box imported sardines
- Mayonnaise, as needed
<|steps|>
Cut crusts off rye bread rounds.
Mash sardines and mix with chopped pickle, eggs, and enough mayonnaise to make a spreadable consistency.
Season to taste and spread on bread rounds.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MINT JULEP**
<|ingredients|>
- Sugar, 0.5 inch per glass
- Water, to dampen
- Finely crushed ice
- 2 sprigs fresh mint per glass
- 0.5-1 jigger bourbon per glass
- Grated nutmeg, for sprinkling
- 12 eggs, separated
- 1.5 pints whiskey
- 2 pints cream
- 1 pint sugar
- Nutmeg, for sprinkling
<|steps|>
Place sugar in each glass and dampen with water.
Pack glass with crushed ice, placing mint sprigs inside the sides.
Add bourbon and sprinkle with nutmeg.
Stir lightly to frost the glass and serve immediately.
**EGGNOG**
Beat egg yolks well, then gradually add sugar, continuing to beat.
Add whiskey a little at a time.
Add 1 pint unbeaten cream, then stiffly beaten egg whites, stirring well.
Whip remaining 1 pint cream and stir in.
Chill overnight, then shake nutmeg on top of each cup before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CAULIFLOWER WITH ONION RINGS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 medium cauliflower (2 packages frozen)
- 11/2 cups water
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 small can evaporated milk
- 4 tablespoons butter
- 4 tablespoons flour
- ⅛ teaspoon pepper
- 1 cup grated yellow cheese
- 1 can fried onion rings
<|steps|>
Divide cauliflower into flowettes.
Cook until just tender.
Drain and save stock.
Add enough stock to canned milk to make two cups.
Make sauce of 4 tablespoons butter, 4 tablespoons flour, ⅛ teaspoon pepper and the two cups of stock-milk mixture.
Arrange in casserole in following order: ½ the cauliflower; ½ cheese; ½ sauce; ½ onion rings.
Repeat.
Bake 25 to 30 minutes at 350° or until very hot and bubbly.
May be made several hours or day before and refrigerated until 30 minutes before serving time.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **QUICK ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 cups flour
- 2 tbsp sugar
- 2 tsp salt
- 1 cup warm sweet milk
- 2 cakes yeast, dissolved in warm water
- 2 tbsp melted lard
- 1 cup flour, for rolling
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients together and let rise for 2 hours.
Roll out, cut into rolls using about 1 cup of flour.
Let rise for 1 hour.
Bake in a moderate oven.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOMATO SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 Tbsp. cream cornstarch
- 3/4 tsp. salt
- 2 Tbsp. vinegar
- 2 cup. tomato juice
- 1 Tbsp. salt (for dressing)
- 1/2 tsp. prepared mustard
- 3/4 cup. vinegar
- 1/2 tsp. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. paprika
- 3/4 cup. salad oil
<|steps|>
Combine cream cornstarch, salt, and vinegar, gradually add tomato juice, heat to boiling, boil 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Pour into individual molds rinsed in cold water, chill until firm, about 3 hours.
Serve on lettuce, top with French dressing.
For French dressing, put dry ingredients in pint jar, add vinegar and salad oil, seal jar, shake vigorously.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN CAKES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup white corn meal
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp baking soda
- 1 heaping tsp baking powder
- 1 egg
- 1 cup buttermilk, approximate
<|steps|>
Sift dry ingredients together.
Add egg and enough buttermilk to make a thin batter.
Beat well and cook on a hot griddle, like pancakes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MEAT LOAF**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 lb. ground beef
- 3/4 cup. bread cubes (about 2 slices)
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1 egg, beaten
- 3/4 cup. milk
- 1/3 cup. catsup
- 1 Tbsp. mustard
- 1 Tbsp. firmly packed brown sugar
<|steps|>
Beat egg, add milk and bread cubes, and let stand.
Mix bread mixture with beef, onion, salt, and pepper; shape into a loaf in a pan.
Combine catsup, mustard, and brown sugar for topping and spread over loaf.
Bake at 350°F for about 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CREAM CHEESE PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 11/2 cups sugar
- ⅓ cup oleo
- 1 tablespoon flour
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup evaporated milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- ⅛ teaspoon salt
- 9 inch unbaked pastry
<|steps|>
Place sugar, oleo and flour in bowl, cream.
Add eggs one at a time, beat thoroughly.
Add milk flavoring and salt mix.
Pour in pastry.
Bake in 400°F for 15 minutes.
Reduce heat to 350° and bake 30 minutes longer.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON ICEBOX PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can sweetened condensed milk
- 1/2 cup. lemon juice
- 2 egg yolks
- 1 graham cracker crust
- Whipped cream
<|steps|>
Mix condensed milk, lemon juice, and egg yolks.
Pour into crust, chill until set.
Top with whipped cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **QUICK AND EASY PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. self-rising flour
- 1/2 cup. butter, melted
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 cup. coconut or 1 cup. fruit preserves
- 1 unbaked pie crust
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, flour, butter, eggs, milk, and vanilla.
Stir in coconut or fruit preserves.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake at 350°F for 40-45 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CUCUMBER PICKLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 gallon cucumbers
- 1.5 lbs brown sugar
- 2 tbsp celery seed
- 2 tbsp mustard seed
- 2 tbsp turmeric
- 2 onions, chopped
- Several pieces horseradish, finely chopped
- 2 tbsp black pepper
- 1 pod red pepper
- 0.5 gallon vinegar
<|steps|>
Boil vinegar, brown sugar, celery seed, mustard seed, turmeric, onions, horseradish, black pepper, and red pepper for 30 minutes.
Pour over cucumbers.
Seal in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOT SPICED TEA**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 qts. water
- 1 tsp. whole cloves
- 1 stick cinnamon
- 1/3 cup. tea or 15 tea bags
- 1 1/4 cup. sugar
- 1 cup. orange juice
- 3/4 cup. fresh lemon juice
<|steps|>
Add spices to water. Bring water to a full boil.
Remove from heat. Add tea immediately.
Brew 4 minutes. Strain.
Add sugar, stir until dissolved.
Add fruit juices.
To reheat for serving, place over low heat. Do not boil.
Serves 25 to 30.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHILI BAKE CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. pork sausage
- 1/3 cup chopped onion
- 1/3 cup chopped green pepper
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 tsp. chili powder
- 1 tsp. cumin (optional)
- 1 No. 2 1/2 can stewed tomatoes (approx. 3 1/2 cups)
- 2 - 10 oz. pkgs. frozen succotash or 2 - 1 lb. cans
- 1 1/2 cups enriched corn meal (self-rising)
- 1 egg, slightly beaten
- 1/2-3/4 cup milk
- 2 Tbsp. sausage drippings
- Green pepper rings
- Pimiento strips
<|steps|>
Brown sausage in a 10-inch skillet, add onion and green pepper, fry until tender.
Drain fat, reserve drippings.
Add salt, chili powder, cumin, tomatoes, and succotash to sausage mixture.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, simmer 30 minutes until succotash is tender.
Mix corn meal with egg, milk, and sausage drippings until moistened.
Spoon onto hot chili mixture, top with green pepper rings and pimiento strips.
Bake at 375°F for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Serves 16.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BAKED HAM AND ASPARAGUS ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- Baked ham, thinly sliced
- Asparagus spears, trimmed
- Melted butter
- Parmesan cheese, grated
<|steps|>
Place 3 asparagus spears on each slice of ham.
Roll up and secure with a toothpick.
Place rolls in a broiler pan.
Drizzle with melted butter and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Broil until hot and bubbly, about 5-7 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SMOKY PEANUTS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/3 cup liquid smoke
- 1/3 cup water
- 1 13 1/2-oz. can salted peanuts
- 2 tablespoons butter
- Salt, to taste
<|steps|>
Combine liquid smoke and water in a saucepan and bring to a boil.
Pour over peanuts in a shallow pan and let stand for 1 hour.
Drain liquid and spread peanuts in the pan.
Toast at 250°F for 1 hour.
Toss with butter and salt to taste. Yields about 3/4 pound.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FIG PRESERVES**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 lb. figs
- Juice of 2 lemons (optional)
- 4 1/2 lb. sugar
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 qt. water
<|steps|>
Soak figs in a mixture of 1 tsp. salt and 1 qt. water for 1 hour; drain.
Divide figs into two boilers, sprinkle with sugar, and let stand for 1 hour.
Boil slowly to 222°F or until transparent, about 30 minutes.
Pack into sterilized jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPANISH PORK CHOPS**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 pork chops
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 cup. chopped green pepper
- 1 can tomato sauce
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Brown chops in skillet, remove.
Sauté onion and green pepper in skillet.
Return chops, add tomato sauce, salt, and pepper.
Cover, simmer 45 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MUSHROOM RICE CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup rice
- 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1 can creamed mushroom soup
- 1 small can mushroom stems and pieces
- Broken pecans or almonds
- 1/2 cup butter
- 12 oranges
- 1 can pineapple chunks
- 1 fresh coconut, grated
- 1 fresh grapefruit
- Juice of 1 lemon
- Sugar, to taste
- Red cherries or strawberries, for garnish
<|steps|>
Boil rice, rinse, and season with nutmeg.
In a well-greased casserole, layer rice, mushroom soup, broken nuts, and mushrooms.
Repeat layers, ending with nuts on top.
Melt butter and pour over the casserole.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes or until heated through.
Optionally, prepare the day before and add melted butter just before baking.
**AMBROSIA**
Peel and cut oranges into chunks.
Add pineapple chunks (with juice), grapefruit segments, lemon juice, and grated coconut.
Sweeten to taste.
Refrigerate overnight to season thoroughly.
Garnish with red cherries or strawberries before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED EGGPLANT**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 eggplant
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 egg
<|steps|>
Wash, pare, and cut eggplant into pieces.
Boil eggplant, onion, salt, and pepper in water to cover until tender.
Drain in a colander, then mix with beaten egg.
Drop mixture by spoonfuls into a hot greased skillet and fry like hotcakes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARROT PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. cooked, mashed carrots
- 1 cup. milk
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp. nutmeg
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 unbaked pie crust
<|steps|>
Mix carrots, milk, sugar, eggs, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake at 400°F for 10 minutes, then 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SALMON DELIGHT**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can salmon
- 1 cup. bread crumbs
- 1/2 cup. chopped celery
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1 egg
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/4 cup. milk
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients thoroughly.
Shape into loaf or patties, place in greased baking dish.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN BEEF HASH**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cans corn beef
- 2 Tbsp. pickle relish
- 2 Tbsp. horseradish
- 1 cup. grated cheese
- 1/2 cup. catsup
<|steps|>
Mix corn beef, pickle relish, horseradish, cheese, and catsup.
Bake at 375°F for 15 minutes.
Serve with hot peach halves.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BLUEBERRY PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 eggs, separated
- 0.5 cup sugar
- 1 8-oz pkg Philadelphia cream cheese
- 1 cup sour cream
- 1 tsp vanilla
- 1 tbsp flour
- 1 tsp lemon juice
- 1 cup blueberries, drained
- 1 cup blueberry juice
- 0.5 cup sugar
- 2 tbsp cornstarch
<|steps|>
Beat egg yolks and whites separately.
Mix yolks with 0.5 cup sugar, cream cheese, sour cream, vanilla, flour, and lemon juice.
Fold in egg whites and pour into two 8-inch pie crusts.
Bake at 325°F for 45 minutes.
For topping, cook blueberries, juice, 0.5 cup sugar, and cornstarch until thick.
Pour over cooled pies, for 12 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PEA AND WATER CHESTNUT CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/3 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 cup. finely chopped celery
- 1/2 stick oleo
- 1 can mushroom soup
- 1 can English peas, drained
- 1 can water chestnuts, drained
<|steps|>
Cook onion and celery in oleo over low heat until tender.
Add mushroom soup.
Thinly slice water chestnuts and add to the mixture.
Mix in peas.
Place in a casserole and bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BLACK CHERRY SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 pkg. cherry Jell-O
- 2 No. 2 cans black, pitted cherries
- 1 No. 2 can crushed pineapple
- 1 envelope Knox plain gelatin
<|steps|>
Take liquid from cherries and pineapple, finish out to 4 cups liquid.
Heat liquid, pour over Jell-O.
Soften gelatin in 2 Tbsp. water, add to Jell-O mixture, stir in cherries and pineapple.
Set in refrigerator for at least 2 hours before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **REFRIGERATOR ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1¾ cups warm water (110-115°F)
- 2 packages active dry yeast
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1 tablespoon salt
- 1 egg, unbeaten
- 1/4 cup soft butter or margarine
- 6 cups sifted all-purpose flour
- 1 tablespoon butter, melted
<|steps|>
Pour warm water into a large bowl (rinsed with hot water) and check temperature to ensure it's warm, not hot.
Sprinkle yeast over water, add sugar and salt, and stir to dissolve completely.
Add egg, soft butter, and 3 cups flour; beat with a wooden spoon or electric mixer at medium speed for 2 minutes until smooth.
Gradually add 1 cup flour, beating hard after each addition, then work in remaining 2 cups flour with hands until smooth and elastic.
Brush the top of the dough with melted butter, cover with a double thickness of plastic wrap or a damp towel, and let rise in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or until doubled in bulk.
Punch down dough and refrigerate, punching down once a day for 1-3 days.
Shape into rolls, place in greased pans, and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size.
Bake at 400-425°F for 15-20 minutes, depending on roll shape and size.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **EASY CHICKEN & RICE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. (scant) cooked rice
- 1 cup. chicken stock
- 2 cup. cooked chicken, chopped
- Grated cheese
- 4 hard-cooked eggs, sliced
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
<|steps|>
Place rice in a casserole, add stock.
Cover with a layer of chicken and egg slices.
Pour soup over this.
Top with cheese.
Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until hot or bubbly.
Yield: 6 to 8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON-COCONUT COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup butter
- 11/2 cups sugar
- 1 egg
- 1/2 teaspoon grated lemon rind
- 2 cups sifted flour
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup flaked coconut
<|steps|>
Cream butter, add sugar, and continue creaming until light and fluffy.
Add egg and grated lemon rind; beat well.
Sift flour and salt together, then stir into the creamed mixture.
Blend in flaked coconut.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased baking sheet.
Bake at 325°F for 15-20 minutes until lightly browned around the edges.
Remove from baking sheets and cool on wire racks.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COLOSSAL CORN BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 package active dry yeast or cake yeast
- 1/4 cup very warm water
- 2 cups milk, scalded
- 1/3 cup granulated sugar
- 1/3 cup shortening
- 1 tablespoon salt
- 3 cups sifted all-purpose flour
- 2 eggs, well-beaten
- 1 cup yellow corn meal
- 4 to 41/2 cups sifted all-purpose flour
<|steps|>
Sprinkle yeast into very warm water in a measuring cup and stir until dissolved.
In a large mixing bowl, combine scalded milk, sugar, shortening, and salt; stir in 3 cups flour until blended.
Add eggs, yeast mixture, and corn meal; gradually stir in 4 cups flour.
On a lightly floured board, knead dough for 10 minutes until smooth and plastic, using remaining flour as needed.
Place dough in a large greased bowl, turning to grease all sides; cover with a towel and let rise in a warm place (85°F) for about 1½ hours or until doubled in size.
Grease two Pyrex loaf pans.
Turn dough onto a floured surface, knead for 1-2 minutes, shape into loaves, and place seam side down in pans.
Let rise in a warm place until doubled in size.
Bake at 375°F (or 350°F for Pyrex) for 35-45 minutes.
Turn out to cool on their sides on a wire rack.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COCONUT PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/4 cup. flour
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 2 cup. milk
- 2 egg yolks
- 1 cup. coconut
- 1 Tbsp. butter
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 baked pie crust
- Meringue (2 egg whites, 1/4 cup. sugar)
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, flour, and salt, add milk, cook until thickened.
Beat egg yolks, add some hot mixture, return to pan, cook 2 minutes.
Add coconut, butter, and vanilla, cool.
Pour into pie crust, top with meringue, bake at 350°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ESCALLOPED EGGPLANT WITH TOMATOES**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 medium eggplants
- 0.33 cup oil for sautéing
- Flour for dredging
- 1 can tomatoes
- 2 tbsp minced onion
- 1 tbsp margarine
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp pepper
- 0.25 cup minced parsley
<|steps|>
Peel eggplants, cut into 0.75-inch fingers, sprinkle with salt, and let stand for 1 hour.
Drain, dry between paper towels, dredge lightly with flour, and sauté in oil until lightly browned.
For tomato sauce, sauté onions in margarine until tender.
Add tomatoes, salt, pepper, and parsley; simmer for 20 minutes, then strain to remove seeds and pulp.
Arrange eggplant and tomato sauce in alternate layers in a baking pan.
Bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes, for 12 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BING CHERRY SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup chopped nuts
- 1 pkg strawberry Jell-O
- 1 pkg cherry Jell-O
- 1 can Bing cherries
- 1 can crushed pineapple
- 2 small bottles Coca-Cola, cold
- 2 small pkgs cream cheese, chopped
<|steps|>
Drain juice from cherries and pineapple to make 2 cups.
Heat juice and dissolve Jell-O; cool to syrup stage in refrigerator.
Add Coca-Cola, pineapple, cherries, nuts, and cream cheese.
Pour into a glass container and congeal, for 8-10 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CANDIED SWEET POTATOES**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. water
- 1 cup. sugar
- Pinch of salt
- Juice of small lemon
- Sweet potatoes (quantity not specified)
<|steps|>
Make syrup of water, sugar, salt, and lemon juice.
Cut potatoes lengthwise in quarters or eights, drop in boiling syrup, cook until tender, turning once or twice.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARROT-APPLE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. orange Jello
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1 1/2 cups boiling water
- 1 - 8 oz. cream cheese
- 1/2 cup orange juice
- 1/2 tsp. grated lemon rind
- 2 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 cup shredded carrots
- 1 cup chopped unpeeled apple
<|steps|>
Dissolve Jello and sugar in boiling water.
Add cream cheese, beat smooth with electric mixer.
Stir in orange juice, lemon rind, and lemon juice.
Chill until partially congealed.
Add carrots and apple.
Chill until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BING CHERRY SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 box cherry (or any red) gelatin
- 1 large bottle stuffed Spanish olives
- 1 large can Bing (or black) cherries
- 1/2 tablespoon sherry or bourbon
- Juice of 1 lemon
- Chopped almonds or pecans, for garnish
- Homemade mayonnaise, for serving
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin in 1 cup hot cherry juice.
Cool with 1/2 cup cherry juice mixed with lemon juice and sherry or bourbon.
Pour into individual salad molds and chill until set.
Serve with homemade mayonnaise and garnish with chopped almonds or pecans.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BEAN SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can cut green beans
- 1 can cut wax beans
- 1 can red kidney beans
- 1 cup. slivered green pepper
- 1/2 cup. thinly sliced red onion
- 2/3 cup. wine vinegar
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. salad oil
- 1 clove garlic, split
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Rinse and drain beans.
In a large container, combine beans with green pepper and onion.
In a jar, combine vinegar, sugar, oil, garlic, salt, Worcestershire sauce, and pepper; shake vigorously.
Pour over beans, cover tightly, and refrigerate for at least 24 hours, stirring occasionally.
Drain before serving. Improves with longer standing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RUBY'S CHOCOLATE ICE BOX ICE CREAM**
<|ingredients|>
- 3/4 pint heavy cream
- Chopped nuts, as needed
- 1 cake dot chocolate
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup confectioners' sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
<|steps|>
Melt chocolate in a double boiler.
Add beaten egg yolks and 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar to the chocolate.
Whip cream with 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar, then add stiffly beaten egg whites and vanilla.
Line the bottom of an ice tray with finely chopped nuts.
Layer cooled chocolate mixture, whipped cream, and another layer of chocolate.
Top with finely chopped nuts.
Freeze until set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN A LA KING**
<|ingredients|>
- 7 cups cooked chicken
- 5.25 cups mushrooms
- 1.75 cups pimento
- 21 tbsp chicken fat
- 21 tbsp flour
- 30 cups chicken stock
- 2 cups cream
- 7 egg yolks
- 1.75 cups blanched almonds
- 7 tbsp sherry (or more)
- 1 cup water
- 0.5 cup butter
- 1 cup pastry flour
- 0.25 tsp salt
- 4 eggs
<|steps|>
Make sauce by adding flour to chicken fat, then chicken stock and cream.
When sauce is smooth and boiling, add well-beaten egg yolks.
Add chicken, mushrooms, pimento, almonds, and sherry.
Keep hot in a pan of hot water until served.
Serve in puffs (see below) for 30 people.
**PUFFS**
Heat water and butter in a saucepan until boiling.
Add flour and salt, stirring and cooking over a slow fire.
Add unbeaten eggs one at a time, beating well after each.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet.
Bake at 450°F for 15 minutes, then at 325°F for 20 minutes.
Cut puffs in half and fill with chicken a la king or creamed mixtures.
Heat in oven before serving, making 36-40 puffs.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RICE DRESSING FOR GAME OR FOWL**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 tbsp cooking fat
- 1 cup uncooked rice
- 1 quart chicken stock
- 1 cup chopped green pepper
- 1 cup chopped onion
- 1 egg
- Chopped giblets, optional
<|steps|>
Melt cooking fat in an iron skillet and add washed, dried rice.
Stir over heat until rice is light brown.
Add onion, green pepper, and chicken stock.
Cook slowly until rice is tender, adding hot water if too thick.
Just before removing from heat, add whole egg and optional giblets, stirring well.
Use as stuffing or serve with fowl.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MARBLE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 3 eggs
- 2 1/2 cup. flour
- 3 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/4 cup. cocoa
- 1/4 cup. hot water
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add alternately with milk and vanilla.
Divide batter, mix cocoa and hot water, add to half the batter.
Spoon both batters into greased pan, swirl, bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STRAWBERRY CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- **Cake:**
- 1 box strawberry jello
- 1/2 cup hot water
- Juice from a 1-pound box of frozen strawberries
- 4 eggs
- 1 box white cake mix
- **Icing:**
- 1 stick oleo or butter
- 1 box confectioners' sugar
- Drained strawberries (from cake)
<|steps|>
**Cake:** Dissolve jello in hot water, then add strawberry juice and eggs.
Mix with white cake mix and beat according to package directions.
Pour into four 8 x 12-inch pans and bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
**Icing:** Combine oleo, confectioners' sugar, and drained strawberries; beat until spreadable.
Spread icing on cooled cake layers.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BUTTER COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. butter
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1 egg
- 2 cup. flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add egg and vanilla.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add to creamed mixture.
Shape into balls or press through cookie press, bake at 375°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **1860 POTATO SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 large Irish potatoes
- Salt, for boiling
- 1 tbsp butter
- Black pepper, to taste
- 0.5 cup vinegar
- 2 tbsp sugar
- 1 tsp chopped green pepper
- 0.5 cup finely chopped celery
- 1 medium onion, finely chopped
- 2 hard-cooked eggs, chopped
- 0.5 cup chow-chow pickle
- 2 tbsp mayonnaise
- Green pepper slices, for garnish
- Egg slices, for garnish
- Parsley, for garnish
<|steps|>
Boil potatoes in salted water until done, then mash.
Add butter and beat until light.
Add vinegar, sugar, green pepper, celery, onion, eggs, chow-chow pickle, and black pepper; blend well.
Add mayonnaise and mix.
Arrange green pepper slices and egg slices on top.
Trim the edge of the bowl with parsley.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ORANGE CHIFFON PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 envelope gelatin
- 1/4 cup. cold water
- 1 cup. orange juice
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 cup. heavy cream, whipped
- 1 baked pie crust
<|steps|>
Soften gelatin in cold water.
Heat orange juice, sugar, and salt, add gelatin, stir until dissolved.
Cool, add lemon juice, fold in whipped cream.
Pour into pie crust, chill until set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GRILLED BACON-WRAPPED WIENERS**
<|ingredients|>
- 16 wieners
- 1 lb. cheddar cheese
- 16 slices bacon or ham
- 16 buttered buns
<|steps|>
Split wieners lengthwise partway.
Cut cheese into long strips and place one in each wiener.
Press wiener together and wrap with bacon or ham, securing ends with toothpicks.
Roast on a grill over hot coals until bacon is crisp and wieners are heated through.
Serve in buttered buns. Yields 8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TUNA CHOW**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can mushroom soup
- 1/4 cup water
- 2 cups chow mein noodles
- 1 can tuna fish
- 1 cup sliced celery
- 1/4 cup chopped onion
- 1/2 cup salted cashew nuts
- Dash of pepper
- 1 can mandarin orange sections
<|steps|>
Combine soup and water.
Add 1 cup of noodles and all other things.
Toss lightly.
Place in ungreased baking dish.
Sprinkle remaining noodles over top.
Bake at 375° for ½ hour.
Just before serving put 1 can of drained mandarin orange sections over top.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MRS. GRAHAM'S FRUIT ROLL**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 1/2 cups apples or other fruit
- 1 1/4 cups sugar
- 1/2 pound butter
- 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1 tablespoon fat
- Biscuit dough
<|steps|>
Add 1 tablespoon fat to biscuit dough and roll thin to 8 inches in diameter.
Spread with 3/4 of the butter and 1 cup sugar.
Slice apples thinly and spread 1 1/2 cups on one edge of the dough.
Fold ends over apples and roll up.
Place in a baking dish and cut through the top crust every 2 inches.
Combine remaining sugar, butter, and apples with 1 cup warm water, pour into the pan, and bake at 350°F for about 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE DROP COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 egg
- 1/4 cup. cocoa
- 1 1/2 cup. flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add egg and cocoa.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt, add alternately with milk and vanilla.
Drop by spoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet, bake at 375°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **APPLESAUCE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 cup. applesauce
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. cloves
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. raisins
- 1/2 cup. nuts
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add egg and applesauce.
Mix flour, baking soda, spices, and salt, add to creamed mixture.
Stir in raisins and nuts.
Pour into greased loaf pan, bake at 350°F for 60-70 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS PEA CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/4 stick butter
- 1 can asparagus tips
- 2 tbsp. cheese, grated
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/2 cup. almonds, sliced (optional)
- 2 cup. canned sweet peas, drained
- 2 hard-boiled eggs, sliced
- 1 can mushroom soup, undiluted
- 1/2 cup. cracker crumbs
<|steps|>
Use part of the butter to grease a casserole dish.
Make layers of peas, asparagus, egg slices, and cheese in the casserole.
Add soup and milk.
Cover with cracker crumbs and almonds.
Dot with remaining butter.
Bake 30 minutes at 425 degrees.
Yield: 6 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOASTED ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- Fresh bread slices
- Finely ground cooked chicken
- Minced broiled mushrooms
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Lemon juice, to taste
- Onion, to taste
- Thickened chicken broth
<|steps|>
Trim edges from fresh bread slices.
Mix ground chicken, mushrooms, salt, pepper, lemon juice, and a hint of onion with enough thickened chicken broth to make a spread.
Spread the mixture on bread slices.
Roll each slice and secure with a toothpick if needed.
Optionally, store in a home freezer.
Toast in the oven until golden brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRENCH SHRIMP SHELLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 tbsp. butter or oleo
- 3 tbsp. flour
- 1 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- Dash pepper
- 1/4 dry sherry
- 1 lb. small, shelled, cooked shrimp
- Grated Parmesan cheese
- Dash paprika
<|steps|>
Melt butter in a saucepan, stir in flour.
Add milk, cook, and stir until thickened.
Stir in salt, pepper, paprika, sherry, and shrimp.
Pour into 5 baking shells.
Sprinkle each with 1 tablespoon Parmesan cheese.
Place under broiler 3 or 4" from heat. Broil until cheese browns.
Lobster or crab may be substituted for shrimp.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MEAT LOAF**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 lb. ground pork
- 1 cup. bread crumbs
- 1 egg
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 tsp. dry mustard
- 1/4 cup. catsup
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients thoroughly.
Shape into loaf, place in baking pan.
Bake at 350°F for 1 1/2 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. shortening
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 cup. cocoa
- 1/2 cup. hot water
- 2 cup. flour
- 2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. buttermilk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream sugar and shortening, add eggs.
Mix cocoa with hot water, add to creamed mixture.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt, add alternately with buttermilk and vanilla.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON JELLO CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. lemon gelatin
- 1 box lemon cake mix
- 3/4 cup. Wesson oil
- 1 cup. boiling water
- 4 eggs
- 1 tbsp. lemon extract
- **Lemon Glaze:**
- 1/4 cup. lemon juice
- 1 1/2 cup. confectioners' sugar
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin in water and let cool slightly.
Add this to the cake mix, then add egg and cooking oil.
After this mixture has cooled, pour into a tube pan and bake in a 350-degree oven for 1 hour.
For the glaze, mix together lemon juice and sugar until smooth.
Ice hot cake.
Note: You may use orange Jello if you wish.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN PILAU**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 chicken, cut up
- 1 cup. rice
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 cup. chopped celery
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 2 cup. chicken broth
<|steps|>
Cook chicken in broth until tender, remove, debone.
Sauté onion and celery, add rice, salt, and pepper.
Add broth and chicken, simmer 20 minutes until rice is tender.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRENCH FRIED ONIONS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 egg
- 1 cup. milk
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 6 medium onions
- 1 cup. flour
- Wesson oil or Snowdrift (for frying)
<|steps|>
Beat egg, add salt and flour, beat until free from lumps.
Slice onions about 1/4 inch thick, separate into rings, dip into batter.
Fry in hot grease a few at a time.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MOOSE STEAK**
<|ingredients|>
- Moose steak
- 1/2 cup onions, finely chopped
- 1/2 cup sweet or sour cream
- 1 cup chopped mushrooms
- 2 Tbsp. butter
- 2 Tbsp. flour
<|steps|>
Fry onions in butter until browned.
Sear steak on both sides in butter and browned onions.
Cover and simmer for 1/2 hour.
When almost tender, add mushrooms and flour stirred into cream.
Cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>
